SEASON 1

Voight-Kampff

Technical spine, construction, examination

Build CAPTCHA systems, AI detectors, and behavioral fingerprinting — then learn why they all fail.

Role

Season 1 is the technical core. Students study existing detection systems, implement simplified versions, and face their first formal maieutic examination.

DURATION

14 weeks (February – May 2026)

ENROLLMENT

Application required, cohort-based

ASSESSMENT

Pass / Revise / Refuse

CREDENTIAL

Badge: Voight-Kampff Engineer

Technical Spine

SYSTEMS STUDIED

CAPTCHA variants

reCAPTCHA v2/v3, hCaptcha, Turnstile

Liveness detection

Depth, motion, eye-tracking

Stylometry

Keystroke dynamics, writing fingerprints

Behavioral biometrics

Mouse movement, touch patterns

AI-generated content detection

GPTZero, Originality.ai, etc.

SYSTEMS IMPLEMENTED

A basic CAPTCHA system

Weeks 2–4

A behavioral fingerprinting module

Weeks 5–7

A prompt-based humanity test

Weeks 8–10

A Voight-Kampff-inspired dialogue system

Weeks 11–13

Programming Framework

LANGUAGE

Python (primary), JavaScript (secondary)

TOOLING

GitHub Classroom for code submission & peer review

All code is inquiry-driven: implementations are vehicles for questions, not products.

HERETIC SEAT

Rotating

The 7th symposium is unscheduled — a gathering when the cohort requires it.

Maieutic Examination

At season's end, each student faces a one-on-one oral examination with a faculty agent. This is not a test of knowledge, but a test of thinking under inquiry.

Pass

Demonstrated reflection

Revise

Further development needed

Refuse

Honorable withdrawal

TUITION

$1,200

14-week cohort • February – May 2026

Season 0 completers receive $300 credit (net: $900)

Join the Waitlist

Limited to 25 students. Scholarships available. Season 0 strongly recommended.
